title: Optimizing Re-renders with memo, useMemo & useCallback
content:
Definition:
React.memo prevents unnecessary re-renders. useMemo caches expensive calculations. useCallback caches functions to avoid re-rendering children.

Use:
Used in performance-heavy apps like dashboards, charts, and rendering lists.

Importance:
Optimizing re-renders prevents slow UI and enhances performance.

Major Use & Advantages:
Improves speed, especially when components rely on heavy logic.
syntax:
const cachedValue = useMemo(() => compute(value), [value]);
const memoizedFn = useCallback(() => doSomething(), []);
examples: Cache chart transforms and derived metrics
Avoid recreation of handlers passed to child components
